com.oracle.tools.runtime
Interface ApplicationSchema<A extends Application<A>,S extends ApplicationSchema<A,S>>

Type Parameters:
A - the type of the Application that will be realized by an ApplicationBuilder using this ApplicationSchema
S - the type of ApplicationSchema that will be returned from setter calls on this interface. This is to permit extensible type-safe fluent-style definitions of setter methods in sub-interfaces.

Copyright (c) 2011. All Rights Reserved. Oracle Corporation.
Oracle is a registered trademark of Oracle Corporation and/or its affiliates.

All Known Subinterfaces:
JavaApplicationSchema<A,S>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractApplicationSchema, AbstractJavaApplicationSchema, SimpleApplicationSchema, SimpleJavaApplicationSchema
public interface ApplicationSchema<A extends Application<A>,S extends ApplicationSchema<A,S>>

ApplicationSchema defines a schema encapsulating configuration and operational settings that an ApplicationBuilder will use to realize an Application.

Author:
Brian Oliver

Method Summary
 List<String> getArguments()
          Obtains the arguments for the Application.
 long getDefaultTimeout()
          Obtains the default duration to used for Application timeouts.
 TimeUnit getDefaultTimeoutUnits()
          Obtains the default duration timeout TimeUnit.
 PropertiesBuilder getEnvironmentVariablesBuilder()
          Obtains the PropertiesBuilder that will be used to determine operating system environment variables to be provided to the Application.
 String getExecutableName()
          Obtains the name of the application executable.
 Iterable<LifecycleEventInterceptor<A>> getLifecycleInterceptors()
          Obtains the LifecycleEventInterceptors that the ApplicationSchema will attach to Applications produced by the said ApplicationSchema.
 File getWorkingDirectory()
          Obtains the File representing the directory in which the application will execute.
 boolean isInherited()
          Determines if the settings and environment variables for the ApplicationSchema should be inherited from the process in which the ApplicationSchema was created.
 

Method Detail

getExecutableName

String getExecutableName()
Obtains the name of the application executable.

Returns:
the name of the executable to run

getWorkingDirectory

File getWorkingDirectory()
Obtains the File representing the directory in which the application will execute.

Returns:
the directory in which the application will run

getEnvironmentVariablesBuilder

PropertiesBuilder getEnvironmentVariablesBuilder()
Obtains the PropertiesBuilder that will be used to determine operating system environment variables to be provided to the Application.

Returns:
PropertiesBuilder

isInherited

boolean isInherited()
Determines if the settings and environment variables for the ApplicationSchema should be inherited from the process in which the ApplicationSchema was created.

Returns:
true if the settings are inherited

getArguments

List<String> getArguments()
Obtains the arguments for the Application.

Returns:
a List of Strings

getDefaultTimeout

long getDefaultTimeout()
Obtains the default duration to used for Application timeouts.

Many programs require timeouts when accessing resources, especially those that are remote or may require waiting for some period of time. In those circumstances, the default timeout is used, unless of course an explicit timeout is specified.

Returns:
the timeout duration (measured in #getTimeoutUnits())

getDefaultTimeoutUnits

TimeUnit getDefaultTimeoutUnits()
Obtains the default duration timeout TimeUnit.

Returns:
the TimeUnit for Application timeouts

getLifecycleInterceptors

Iterable<LifecycleEventInterceptor<A>> getLifecycleInterceptors()
Obtains the LifecycleEventInterceptors that the ApplicationSchema will attach to Applications produced by the said ApplicationSchema.

LifecycleEventInterceptors are typically used by Applications and ApplicationBuilders to raise LifecycleEvents pertaining to the life-cycle of an Application.

Returns:
the LifecycleEventInterceptors
